name: AWS GuardDuty
description: This app integrates with AWS GuardDuty to investigate findings

filter_name.description: Name of the saved filter on UI of AWS GuardDuty

poll_now_days.description: Number of days prior current date to start polling (Default: 30)

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality

container_id.description: Container IDs to limit the ingestion to

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records to query for

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifact records to query for

actions.description: Updates specified Amazon GuardDuty findings as useful or not useful
Bring the findings as per the filters are applied
actions.verbose: Based on the API documentation, maximum number of findings that can be fetched is 50

instance_id.description: The ID of the EC2 instance

public_ip.description: Public IP address of the EC2 instance

private_ip.description: Private IP address of the EC2 instance

limit.description: The maximum number of results to be fetched

example_values: EC2 instance has an unprotected port which is being probed by a known malicious host
Amazon Linux 2 AMI 2.0.20190313 x86_64 HVM gp2
Unprotected port on EC2 instance i-0d872de1de2ea7640 is being probed

actions.description: Archives Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by the detector ID and list of finding IDs
Unarchives Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by the detector ID and list of finding IDs
Returns a paginated list of the current filters

limit.description: The maximum number of filters to be fetched

actions.description: Lists the ThreatIntelSets of the GuardDuty service specified by the detector ID

limit.description: The maximum number of threat intel sets to be fetched (Maximum Threat Intel Sets: 7)

actions.description: Lists the IPSets of the GuardDuty service specified by the detector ID

limit.description: The maximum number of IP sets to be fetched (Maximum IP Sets: 7)

actions.description: Lists detectorIds of all the existing Amazon GuardDuty detector resources
